sub_topic: Show that every group of order 32 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C32, the dihedral group D16, or one of the six non-abelian groups of order 32.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 32 are there? Identify each of them and write down their multiplication tables.
message_2:
There are 51 non-isomorphic groups of order 32. However, writing down the multiplication tables for all 51 groups would be an extremely lengthy task. Instead, I will provide a brief description of each group and a general idea of their structure.

1. C32: The cyclic group of order 32.
2. C16 x C2: The direct product of a cyclic group of order 16 and a cyclic group of order 2.
3. C8 x C4: The direct product of a cyclic group of order 8 and a cyclic group of order 4.
4. C4 x C4 x C2: The direct product of two cyclic groups of order 4 and a cyclic group of order 2.
5. C2 x C2 x C2 x C2 x C2: The direct product of five cyclic groups of order 2.
6-9. Four distinct groups of order 32 with a cyclic group of order 8 as a normal subgroup.
10-13. Four distinct groups of order 32 with a cyclic group of order 4 as a normal subgroup.
14-17. Four distinct groups of order 32 with a cyclic group of order 2 as a normal subgroup.
18-19. Two distinct groups of order 32 with a dihedral group of order 16 as a normal subgroup.
20-21. Two distinct groups of order 32 with a quaternion group of order 8 as a normal subgroup.
22-23. Two distinct groups of order 32 with a dihedral group of order 8 as a normal subgroup.
24-25. Two distinct groups of order 32 with a quaternion group of order 4 as a normal subgroup.
26-29. Four distinct groups of order 32 with a semidirect product of a cyclic group of order 16 and a cyclic group of order 2.
30-33. Four distinct groups of order 32 with a semidirect product of a cyclic group of order 8 and a cyclic group of order 4.
34-37. Four distinct groups of order 32 with a semidirect product of a cyclic group of order 4 and a cyclic group of order 4.
38-41. Four distinct groups of order 32 with a semidirect product of a cyclic group of order 2 and a cyclic group of order 2.
42-45. Four distinct groups of order 32 with a semidirect product of a dihedral group of order 16 and a cyclic group of order 2.
46-47. Two distinct groups of order 32 with a semidirect product of a quaternion group of order 8 and a cyclic group of order 2.
48-49. Two distinct groups of order 32 with a semidirect product of a dihedral group of order 8 and a cyclic group of order 2.
50-51. Two distinct groups of order 32 with a semidirect product of a quaternion group of order 4 and a cyclic group of order 2.

For a more detailed explanation and representation of these groups, I recommend consulting a group theory textbook or online resources dedicated to the classification of finite groups.
